summary: Key data for 2026 Nepal HoR election: NC front-runner due to split left vote and new leadership, RSP rising with Balen Shah, CPN-UML hurt by anti-incumbency, NCP untested merger
content:
## 2026 Nepal Election - Key Findings

**Election**: March 5, 2026. 275 seats (165 FPTP + 110 PR). Candidates already nominated.

**2022 Results**:
- NC: 89 seats (57 FPTP + 32 PR), 25.71% PR vote
- CPN-UML: 78 seats (44 FPTP + 34 PR), 26.95% PR vote
- CPN-MC: 32 seats (14 FPTP + 18 PR), 11.13% PR vote
- RSP: 20 seats (7 FPTP + 13 PR), 10.70% PR vote
- RPP: 14 seats, 5.58% PR vote

**Key 2026 Developments**:
- Gen Z protests (Sept 2025) â†’ Oli resigned, House dissolved
- NCP formed from merger of 10 leftist parties (Nov 2025), excluding CPN-UML
- RSP brought in Balen Shah (popular Kathmandu mayor) as PM candidate
- NC elected Gagan Thapa as new president
- RPP unified with RPP-Nepal
- NC won most seats in recent National Assembly election (Jan 2026)
- Voter survey (Dec 2025): ~60% want to seek new parties

**Structural factors**: FPTP strongly favors established parties. Left vote split between CPN-UML and NCP benefits NC. RSP has urban momentum but limited rural depth.
